statements: SELECT * FROM Customers;
SELECT name, address FROM Customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE customer_id = 2;
SELECT name, phone_number FROM Customers WHERE address LIKE '%Street%';
SELECT customer_id, name, address, phone_number FROM Customers ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Customers ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT name, address FROM Customers WHERE phone_number LIKE '%555%';
SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE address LIKE '%Street%' AND phone_number LIKE '555%';
SELECT name, phone_number FROM Customers WHERE customer_id = 1001;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_customers FROM Customers WHERE address IS NOT NULL;

SELECT customer_id, name, contact_number FROM Customers WHERE address IS NOT NULL;

SELECT name, contact_number FROM Customers WHERE customer_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE name LIKE '%Doe%' ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT customer_id, name, address FROM Customers WHERE address IS NOT NULL ORDER BY name ASC, customer_id ASC;
SELECT customer_id AS id, name AS customer_name, address AS location FROM Customers WHERE contact_number IS NULL;

SELECT customer_id, name, address FROM Customers WHERE customer_id = 1;

SELECT * FROM Addresses WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT order_id, total_amount FROM Orders WHERE total_amount > 1000;
SELECT * FROM Customers;
SELECT name, address FROM Customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT product_name, price FROM Products ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(order_id) AS total_orders FROM Orders GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(order_id) > 2;

SELECT Customers.name, Addresses.address, Orders.order_date FROM Customers JOIN Addresses ON Customers.customer_id = Addresses.customer_id JOIN Orders ON Customers.customer_id = Orders.customer_id WHERE Orders.total_amount > 1000 ORDER BY Orders.order_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM Customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM Customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT product_name, price FROM Products ORDER BY price DESC;
SELECT order_date, total_amount FROM Orders WHERE order_id = 1001;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) AS order_count FROM Orders GROUP BY customer_id;
SELECT * FROM Customers WHERE customer_id = 1
SELECT first_name, last_name, address FROM Customers WHERE last_name LIKE 'S%'
SELECT product_name, price FROM Products ORDER BY price DESC
SELECT order_id, order_date, total_amount FROM Orders WHERE total_amount > 1000

SELECT c.first_name, c.last_name, p.product_name, oi.quantity FROM Customers c JOIN Orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id JOIN Order_Items oi ON oi.order_id = o.order_id JOIN Products p ON p.product_id = oi.product_id
